snippet: The new standard, which comes nearly two years after a public outcry, is equal to the level that the Environmental Protection Agency has set in drinking water.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration is proposing new limit on acceptable levels of arsenic in apple juice; new standard, which comes nearly two years after a public outcry on issue, is equal to level that Environmental Protection Agency has set in drinking water.
lead_paragraph: The new standard, which comes nearly two years after a public outcry, is equal to the level that the Environmental Protection Agency has set in drinking water.

headline.main: New Limits for Arsenic Proposed by F.D.A.
headline.print_headline: New Limits For Arsenic Proposed By F.D.A.
